title: Revenge of the Cybermen
dialogue_disasters: You have the philosophy of a cringing mouse, Tyrum.
goofs: The Doctor was wearing a long brown coat and hat at the end of the previous story, but they've vanished when he materialises
Lester wears his Interplanetary Space Command insignia upside-down
There is air and gravity inside a four-kilometre-wide asteroid, and a noisy explosion in space
Cybermats are hugged to make them look as if they're attacking
Obvious NASA footage is used for the rocket take-off
The Cyberleader shakes the Doctor's shoulders in what appears to be Swedish massage rather than strangulation
A spinning roll of lunar landscape simulates a near-miss of the asteroid
If the transmat only works on human tissue, why doesn't it wreck Cybermen and leave humans naked?
When the Doctor enters the TARDIS in episode four the paper print-out of the space/time telegraph can be seen hanging on a hook just inside the door
Voga is the Planet of Gold, but when the Cybermen arrive, two of them gun down half of the Vogan army with non-gold bullets

continuity_notes.name: Cybermen
continuity_notes.description: Cybernetic beings susceptible to gold, expressing emotions despite their nature. Bullet-proof with hydraulic muscles and head-mounted weapons.
continuity_notes.current_status: Reduced to one ship, seeking revenge

continuity_notes.name: Gold
continuity_notes.description: Non-corrodable metal that clogs Cybermen's breathing apparatus and blocks their radar
continuity_notes.current_status: Used as a weapon against Cybermen

continuity_notes.name: Glittergun
continuity_notes.description: Weapon that can destroy Cybermen using gold
continuity_notes.current_status: Mentioned as a defense against Cybermen

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine
continuity_notes.current_status: Drifts back through time and space to meet the Doctor

technobabble: Phobic energy in physics rather than psychology
roots: Misquotes of Descartes ('Cogito ergo sum: I think therefore it missed')
Misquotes of Macbeth ('Out, out, dusty death')
Voga as a reference to an island of gold that Columbus was looking for in the Atlantic

locations.name: Nerva Beacon
locations.description: Military beacon orbiting Jupiter, monitoring Earth-Pluto flights

future_history: Nerva Beacon orbits Jupiter as a military station before becoming the cryogenic space ark Terra Nova. Earth-Pluto flights are regular occurrences.
untold_adventures: The Doctor mentions meeting Harry Houdini
additional_notes: The Cybermen's appearance includes flares, giving them a smiling expression. The episode contains several double entendres.
bottom_line: A contradictory, tedious, and unimaginative mess. The humans know the Cybermen are going to arrive, yet are surprised when they do, and talk fondly of the Doctor and companions having just been suspicious of them. No time. No money. No mercy. Even the title's rubbish.
